== Alternative ways to run development releases ==

=== Without Any Tools ===

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| '''Devel release as main work environment'''
|-
| ''Howto''
| 
|-
| ''quick Howto''
| on a Desktop machine: `sudo update-manager -d`, on a Server: `sudo do-release-upgrade -d`
|-
| ''Advantages''
| - tests the devel release on real HW<<BR>>- always the latest packages
|-
| ''Disadvantages''
| - will have bugs<<BR>>- sometimes explodes spectacularly (also we never had data-loss in the past)
|}

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| '''separate partition with Ubuntu development release'''
|-
| ''Howto''
| https://help.ubuntu.com/12.04/installation-guide/
|-
| ''quick Howto''
| 
|-
| ''Advantages''
| - tests the devel release on real HW<<BR>>- safe (because there is a partition with ubuntu/stable as backup)
|-
| ''Disadvantages''
| - rebooting into devel partition takes time<<BR>>- requires unpartitioned space, or resizeable volumes<<BR>>- installer bugs may eat data (make backups!)<<BR>>
|}

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| '''separate machine with Ubuntu development release'''
|-
| ''Howto''
| https://help.ubuntu.com/12.04/installation-guide/
|-
| ''quick Howto''
| 
|-
| ''Advantages''
| - tests the devel release on real HW<<BR>>- safe (because there is a partition with ubuntu/stable as backup)
|-
| ''Disadvantages''
| - requires more electricity and desk space<<BR>>
|}

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| '''use the Live``CD'''
|-
| ''Howto''
| https://help.ubuntu.com/community/LiveCD
|-
| ''quick Howto''
| download iso from http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/daily-live/current/ - burn it - boot it
|-
| ''Advantages''
| - tests the devel release on real HW<<BR>>- safe (because no changes are written to the hard disk)<<BR>>- you can install packages on the running Live``CD
|-
| ''Disadvantages''
| - rebooting into devel partition takes time<<BR>>- much slower
|}

=== Using Tools ===

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| '''chroot'''
|-
| ''Howto''
| <nowiki>[[DebootstrapChroot]]</nowiki>
|-
| ''quick Howto''
| `sudo apt-get install debootstrap; sudo debootstrap <development release> <directory>`
|-
| ''Advantages''
| - easy setup<<BR>>- self-contained
|-
| ''Disadvantages''
| - testing graphical applications isn't straight-forward
|}

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| '''kvm'''
|-
| ''Howto''
| https://help.ubuntu.com/community/KVM
|-
| ''quick Howto''
| sudo apt-get install kvm virt-manager libvirt-bin
|-
| ''Advantages''
| - Feels like a real machine<<BR>>- does not need special kernel modules
|-
| ''Disadvantages''
| - Does not test the devel release on different hardware<<BR>>- needs modern CPU with virtualisation support<<BR>>- some slowdown; requires spare disk space
|}

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| '''virtualbox'''
|-
| ''Howto''
| https://help.ubuntu.com/community/VirtualBox
|-
| ''quick Howto''
| sudo apt-get install virtualbox-ose virtualbox-ose-modules-`uname -r`
|-
| ''Advantages''
| - Feels like a real machine<<BR>>- works on CPUs without hardware virtualisation support<<BR>>- snapshot support
|-
| ''Disadvantages''
| - Does not test the devel release on different hardware<<BR>>- some slowdown; requires spare disk space
|}

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| '''vmware'''
|-
| ''Howto''
| 
|-
| ''quick Howto''
| 
|-
| ''Advantages''
| - supports snapshots
|-
| ''Disadvantages''
| - not free software<<BR>>- requires out of tree kernel modules<<BR>>- some slowdown; requires spare disk space
|}

== Building Packages ==
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| '''pbuilder'''
|-
| ''Howto''
| <nowiki>[[PbuilderHowto]]</nowiki>
|-
| ''quick Howto''
| `sudo apt-get install pbuilder; sudo pbuilder create`
|-
| ''Advantages''
| - easy setup<<BR>>- capability of building for different releases (using `pbuilder-dist` of `ubuntu-dev-tools` package)<<BR>>- self-contained
|-
| ''Disadvantages''
| - less useful for testing fixes
|}

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| '''using a PPA'''
|-
| ''Howto''
| http://help.launchpad.net/PPA
|-
| ''quick Howto''
| 
|-
| ''Advantages''
| - good way to test if a package builds on various releases<<BR>>- good way to ask for testing of built packages
|-
| ''Disadvantages''
| - just covers the 'build side' of testing
|}

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| '''sbuild'''
|-
| ''Howto''
| <nowiki>[[SbuildLVMHowto]]</nowiki>
|-
| ''quick Howto''
| `sudo apt-get install ubuntu-dev-tools; mk-sbuild-lv <vg> <release>`
|-
| ''Advantages''
| - fast<<BR>>- easy setup<<BR>>- identical results to builds<<BR>>- capable of building for different releases
|-
| ''Disadvantages''
| - requires LVM and spare LVs
|}
